verb.description: Raise doubts or objections or show reluctance.
examples: normally she would have accepted the challenge, but she demurred

noun.description: The action or process of objecting to or hesitating over something.
examples: they accepted this ruling without demur

origin: Middle English (in the sense linger, delay): from Old French demourer (verb), demeure (noun), based on Latin de- away, completely + morari delay.
